00022 /*! \file
00023  *
00024  * \brief Mute Daemon
00025  *
00026  * \author Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com>
00027  *
00028  * Updated for Mac OSX CoreAudio 
00029  * \arg Josh Roberson <josh@asteriasgi.com>
00030  *
00031  * \note Specially written for Malcolm Davenport, but I think I'll use it too
00032  * Connects to the Asterisk Manager Interface, AMI, and listens for events
00033  * on certain devices. If a phone call is connected to one of the devices (phones)
00034  * the local sound is muted to a lower volume during the call.
00035  *
00036  */
00037 
00038 #ifndef __Darwin__
00039 #include <linux/soundcard.h>
00040 #else
00041 #include <CoreAudio/AudioHardware.h> 
00042 #endif
00043 #include <stdio.h>
00044 #include <errno.h>
00045 #include <stdlib.h>
00046 #include <unistd.h>
00047 #include <fcntl.h>
00048 #include <string.h>
00049 #include <netdb.h>
00050 #include <sys/socket.h>
00051 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00052 #include <netinet/in.h>
00053 #include <arpa/inet.h>
00054 
00055 static char *config = "/etc/muted.conf";
00056 
00057 static char host[256] = "";
00058 static char user[256] = "";
00059 static char pass[256] = "";
00060 static int smoothfade = 0;
00061 static int mutelevel = 20;
00062 static int muted = 0;
00063 static int needfork = 1;
00064 static int debug = 0;
00065 static int stepsize = 3;
00066 #ifndef __Darwin__
00067 static int mixchan = SOUND_MIXER_VOLUME;
00068 #endif

00070 struct subchannel {
00071    char *name;
00072    struct subchannel *next;
00073 };
00074 
00075 static struct channel {
00076    char *tech;
00077    char *location;
00078    struct channel *next;
00079    struct subchannel *subs;
00080 } *channels;
00081 
00082 static void add_channel(char *tech, char *location)
00083 {
00084    struct channel *chan;
00085    chan = malloc(sizeof(struct channel));
00086    if (chan) {
00087       memset(chan, 0, sizeof(struct channel));
00088       chan->tech = strdup(tech);
00089       chan->location = strdup(location);
00090       chan->next = channels;
00091       channels = chan;
00092    }
00093    
00094 }
00095 
00096 static int load_config(void)
00097 {
00098    FILE *f;
00099    char buf[1024];
00100    char *val;
00101    char *val2;
00102    int lineno=0;
00103    int x;
00104    f = fopen(config, "r");
00105    if (!f) {
00106       fprintf(stderr, "Unable to open config file '%s': %s\n", config, strerror(errno));
00107       return -1;
00108    }
00109    while(!feof(f)) {
00110       fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), f);
00111       if (!feof(f)) {
00112          lineno++;
00113          val = strchr(buf, '#');
00114          if (val) *val = '\0';
00115          while(strlen(buf) && (buf[strlen(buf) - 1] < 33))
00116             buf[strlen(buf) - 1] = '\0';
00117          if (!strlen(buf))
00118             continue;
00119          val = buf;
00120          while(*val) {
00121             if (*val < 33)
00122                break;
00123             val++;
00124          }
00125          if (*val) {
00126             *val = '\0';
00127             val++;
00128             while(*val && (*val < 33)) val++;
00129          }
00130          if (!strcasecmp(buf, "host")) {
00131             if (val && strlen(val))
00132                strncpy(host, val, sizeof(host) - 1);
00133             else
00134                fprintf(stderr, "host needs an argument (the host) at line %d\n", lineno);
00135          } else if (!strcasecmp(buf, "user")) {
00136             if (val && strlen(val))
00137                strncpy(user, val, sizeof(user) - 1);
00138             else
00139                fprintf(stderr, "user needs an argument (the user) at line %d\n", lineno);
00140          } else if (!strcasecmp(buf, "pass")) {
00141             if (val && strlen(val))
00142                strncpy(pass, val, sizeof(pass) - 1);
00143             else
00144                fprintf(stderr, "pass needs an argument (the password) at line %d\n", lineno);
00145          } else if (!strcasecmp(buf, "smoothfade")) {
00146             smoothfade = 1;
00147          } else if (!strcasecmp(buf, "mutelevel")) {
00148             if (val && (sscanf(val, "%d", &x) == 1) && (x > -1) && (x < 101)) {
00149                mutelevel = x;
00150             } else 
00151                fprintf(stderr, "mutelevel must be a number from 0 (most muted) to 100 (no mute) at line %d\n", lineno);
00152          } else if (!strcasecmp(buf, "channel")) {
00153             if (val && strlen(val)) {
00154                val2 = strchr(val, '/');
00155                if (val2) {
00156                   *val2 = '\0';
00157                   val2++;
00158                   add_channel(val, val2);
00159                } else
00160                   fprintf(stderr, "channel needs to be of the format Tech/Location at line %d\n", lineno);
00161             } else
00162                fprintf(stderr, "channel needs an argument (the channel) at line %d\n", lineno);
00163          } else {
00164             fprintf(stderr, "ignoring unknown keyword '%s'\n", buf);
00165          }
00166       }
00167    }
00168    fclose(f);
00169    if (!strlen(host))
00170       fprintf(stderr, "no 'host' specification in config file\n");
00171    else if (!strlen(user))
00172       fprintf(stderr, "no 'user' specification in config file\n");
00173    else if (!channels) 
00174       fprintf(stderr, "no 'channel' specifications in config file\n");
00175    else
00176       return 0;
00177    return -1;
00178 }
00179 
00180 static FILE *astf;
00181 #ifndef __Darwin__
00182 static int mixfd;
00183 
00184 static int open_mixer(void)
00185 {
00186    mixfd = open("/dev/mixer", O_RDWR);
00187    if (mixfd < 0) {
00188       fprintf(stderr, "Unable to open /dev/mixer: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00189       return -1;
00190    }
00191    return 0;
00192 }
00193 #endif /* !__Darwin */

00195 /*! Connect to the asterisk manager interface */
00196 static int connect_asterisk(void)
00197 {
00198    int sock;
00199    struct hostent *hp;
00200    char *ports;
00201    int port = 5038;
00202    struct sockaddr_in sin;
00203 
00204    ports = strchr(host, ':');
00205    if (ports) {
00206       *ports = '\0';
00207       ports++;
00208       if ((sscanf(ports, "%d", &port) != 1) || (port < 1) || (port > 65535)) {
00209          fprintf(stderr, "'%s' is not a valid port number in the hostname\n", ports);
00210          return -1;
00211       }
00212    }
00213    hp = gethostbyname(host);
00214    if (!hp) {
00215       fprintf(stderr, "Can't find host '%s'\n", host);
00216       return -1;
00217    }
00218    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00219    if (sock < 0) {
00220       fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create socket: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00221       return -1;
00222    }
00223    sin.sin_family = AF_INET;
00224    sin.sin_port = htons(port);
00225    memcpy(&sin.sin_addr, hp->h_addr, sizeof(sin.sin_addr));
00226    if (connect(sock, &sin, sizeof(sin))) {
00227       fprintf(stderr, "Failed to connect to '%s' port '%d': %s\n", host, port, strerror(errno));
00228       close(sock);
00229       return -1;
00230    }
00231    astf = fdopen(sock, "r+");
00232    if (!astf) {
00233       fprintf(stderr, "fdopen failed: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00234       close(sock);
00235       return -1;
00236    }
00237    return 0;
00238 }
00239 
00240 static char *get_line(void)
00241 {
00242    static char buf[1024];
00243    if (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), astf)) {
00244       while(strlen(buf) && (buf[strlen(buf) - 1] < 33))
00245          buf[strlen(buf) - 1] = '\0';
00246       return buf;
00247    } else
00248       return NULL;
00249 }
00250 
00251 /*! Login to the asterisk manager interface */
00252 static int login_asterisk(void)
00253 {
00254    char *welcome;
00255    char *resp;
00256    if (!(welcome = get_line())) {
00257       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (1)\n");
00258       return -1;
00259    }
00260    fprintf(astf, 
00261       "Action: Login\r\n"
00262       "Username: %s\r\n"
00263       "Secret: %s\r\n\r\n", user, pass);
00264    if (!(welcome = get_line())) {
00265       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (2)\n");
00266       return -1;
00267    }
00268    if (strcasecmp(welcome, "Response: Success")) {
00269       fprintf(stderr, "login failed ('%s')\n", welcome);
00270       return -1;
00271    }
00272    /* Eat the rest of the event */
00273    while((resp = get_line()) && strlen(resp));
00274    if (!resp) {
00275       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (3)\n");
00276       return -1;
00277    }
00278    fprintf(astf, 
00279       "Action: Status\r\n\r\n");
00280    if (!(welcome = get_line())) {
00281       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (4)\n");
00282       return -1;
00283    }
00284    if (strcasecmp(welcome, "Response: Success")) {
00285       fprintf(stderr, "status failed ('%s')\n", welcome);
00286       return -1;
00287    }
00288    /* Eat the rest of the event */
00289    while((resp = get_line()) && strlen(resp));
00290    if (!resp) {
00291       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (5)\n");
00292       return -1;
00293    }
00294    return 0;
00295 }
00296 
00297 static struct channel *find_channel(char *channel)
00298 {
00299    char tmp[256] = "";
00300    char *s, *t;
00301    struct channel *chan;
00302    strncpy(tmp, channel, sizeof(tmp) - 1);
00303    s = strchr(tmp, '/');
00304    if (s) {
00305       *s = '\0';
00306       s++;
00307       t = strrchr(s, '-');
00308       if (t) {
00309          *t = '\0';
00310       }
00311       if (debug)
00312          printf("Searching for '%s' tech, '%s' location\n", tmp, s);
00313       chan = channels;
00314       while(chan) {
00315          if (!strcasecmp(chan->tech, tmp) && !strcasecmp(chan->location, s)) {
00316             if (debug)
00317                printf("Found '%s'/'%s'\n", chan->tech, chan->location);
00318             break;
00319          }
00320          chan = chan->next;
00321       }
00322    } else
00323       chan = NULL;
00324    return chan;
00325 }
00326 
00327 #ifndef __Darwin__
00328 static int getvol(void)
00329 {
00330    int vol;
00331 
00332    if (ioctl(mixfd, MIXER_READ(mixchan), &vol)) {
00333 #else
00334 static float getvol(void)
00335 {
00336    float volumeL, volumeR, vol;
00337    OSStatus err;
00338    AudioDeviceID device;
00339    UInt32 size;
00340    UInt32 channels[2];
00341 
00342    size = sizeof(device);
00343    err = AudioHardwareGetProperty(kAudioHardwarePropertyDefaultOutputDevice, &size, &device);
00344    size = sizeof(channels);
00345    if (!err) 
00346       err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(device, 0, false, kAudioDevicePropertyPreferredChannelsForStereo, &size, &channels);
00347    size = sizeof(vol);
00348    if (!err)
00349       err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(device, channels[0], false, kAudioDevicePropertyVolumeScalar, &size, &volumeL);
00350    if (!err)
00351       err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(device, channels[1], false, kAudioDevicePropertyVolumeScalar, &size, &volumeR);
00352    if (!err)
00353       vol = (volumeL < volumeR) ? volumeR : volumeL;
00354    else {
00355 #endif
00356       fprintf(stderr, "Unable to read mixer volume: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00357       return -1;
00358    }
00359    return vol;
00360 }
00361 
00362 #ifndef __Darwin__
00363 static int setvol(int vol)
00364 #else
00365 static int setvol(float vol)
00366 #endif
00367 {
00368 #ifndef __Darwin__
00369    if (ioctl(mixfd, MIXER_WRITE(mixchan), &vol)) {
00370 #else 
00371    float volumeL = vol;
00372    float volumeR = vol;
00373    OSStatus err;
00374    AudioDeviceID device;
00375    UInt32 size;
00376    UInt32 channels[2];
00377 
00378    size = sizeof(device);
00379    err = AudioHardwareGetProperty(kAudioHardwarePropertyDefaultOutputDevice, &size, &device);
00380    size = sizeof(channels);
00381    err = AudioDeviceGetProperty(device, 0, false, kAudioDevicePropertyPreferredChannelsForStereo, &size, &channels);
00382    size = sizeof(vol);
00383    if (!err)
00384       err = AudioDeviceSetProperty(device, 0, channels[0], false, kAudioDevicePropertyVolumeScalar, size, &volumeL);
00385    if (!err)
00386       err = AudioDeviceSetProperty(device, 0, channels[1], false, kAudioDevicePropertyVolumeScalar, size, &volumeR); 
00387    if (err) {
00388 #endif
00389 
00390       fprintf(stderr, "Unable to write mixer volume: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00391       return -1;
00392 
00393    }
00394    return 0;
00395 }
00396 
00397 #ifndef __Darwin__
00398 static int oldvol = 0;
00399 static int mutevol = 0;
00400 #else
00401 static float oldvol = 0;
00402 static float mutevol = 0;
00403 #endif
00404 
00405 #ifndef __Darwin__
00406 static int mutedlevel(int orig, int mutelevel)
00407 {
00408    int l = orig >> 8;
00409    int r = orig & 0xff;
00410    l = (float)(mutelevel) * (float)(l) / 100.0;
00411    r = (float)(mutelevel) * (float)(r) / 100.0;
00412 
00413    return (l << 8) | r;
00414 #else
00415 static float mutedlevel(float orig, float mutelevel)
00416 {
00417    float master = orig;
00418    master = mutelevel * master / 100.0;
00419    return master;
00420 #endif
00421    
00422 }
00423 
00424 static void mute(void)
00425 {
00426 #ifndef __Darwin__
00427    int vol;
00428    int start;
00429    int x;
00430 #else
00431    float vol;
00432    float start = 1.0;
00433    float x;
00434 #endif
00435    vol = getvol();
00436    oldvol = vol;
00437    if (smoothfade)
00438 #ifdef __Darwin__ 
00439       start = mutelevel;
00440 #else
00441       start = 100;
00442    else
00443       start = mutelevel;
00444 #endif
00445    for (x=start;x>=mutelevel;x-=stepsize) {
00446       mutevol = mutedlevel(vol, x);
00447       setvol(mutevol);
00448       /* Wait 0.01 sec */
00449       usleep(10000);
00450    }
00451    mutevol = mutedlevel(vol, mutelevel);
00452    setvol(mutevol);
00453    if (debug)
00454 #ifdef __Darwin__
00455       printf("Mute from '%f' to '%f'!\n", oldvol, mutevol);
00456 #else
00457       printf("Mute from '%04x' to '%04x'!\n", oldvol, mutevol);
00458 #endif
00459    muted = 1;
00460 }
00461 
00462 static void unmute(void)
00463 {
00464 #ifdef __Darwin__
00465    float vol;
00466    float start;
00467    float x;
00468 #else
00469    int vol;
00470    int start;
00471    int x;
00472 #endif
00473    vol = getvol();
00474    if (debug)
00475 #ifdef __Darwin__
00476       printf("Unmute from '%f' (should be '%f') to '%f'!\n", vol, mutevol, oldvol);
00477    mutevol = vol;
00478    if (vol == mutevol) {
00479 #else
00480       printf("Unmute from '%04x' (should be '%04x') to '%04x'!\n", vol, mutevol, oldvol);
00481    if ((int)vol == mutevol) {
00482 #endif
00483       if (smoothfade)
00484          start = mutelevel;
00485       else
00486 #ifdef __Darwin__
00487          start = 1.0;
00488 #else
00489          start = 100;
00490 #endif
00491       for (x=start;x<100;x+=stepsize) {
00492          mutevol = mutedlevel(oldvol, x);
00493          setvol(mutevol);
00494          /* Wait 0.01 sec */
00495          usleep(10000);
00496       }
00497       setvol(oldvol);
00498    } else
00499       printf("Whoops, it's already been changed!\n");
00500    muted = 0;
00501 }
00502 
00503 static void check_mute(void)
00504 {
00505    int offhook = 0;
00506    struct channel *chan;
00507    chan = channels;
00508    while(chan) {
00509       if (chan->subs) {
00510          offhook++;
00511          break;
00512       }
00513       chan = chan->next;
00514    }
00515    if (offhook && !muted)
00516       mute();
00517    else if (!offhook && muted)
00518       unmute();
00519 }
00520 
00521 static void delete_sub(struct channel *chan, char *name)
00522 {
00523    struct subchannel *sub, *prev;
00524    prev = NULL;
00525    sub = chan->subs;
00526    while(sub) {
00527       if (!strcasecmp(sub->name, name)) {
00528          if (prev)
00529             prev->next = sub->next;
00530          else
00531             chan->subs = sub->next;
00532          free(sub->name);
00533          free(sub);
00534          return;
00535       }
00536       prev = sub;
00537       sub = sub->next;
00538    }
00539 }
00540 
00541 static void append_sub(struct channel *chan, char *name)
00542 {
00543    struct subchannel *sub;
00544    sub = chan->subs;
00545    while(sub) {
00546       if (!strcasecmp(sub->name, name)) 
00547          return;
00548       sub = sub->next;
00549    }
00550    sub = malloc(sizeof(struct subchannel));
00551    if (sub) {
00552       memset(sub, 0, sizeof(struct subchannel));
00553       sub->name = strdup(name);
00554       sub->next = chan->subs;
00555       chan->subs = sub;
00556    }
00557 }
00558 
00559 static void hangup_chan(char *channel)
00560 {
00561    struct channel *chan;
00562    if (debug)
00563       printf("Hangup '%s'\n", channel);
00564    chan = find_channel(channel);
00565    if (chan)
00566       delete_sub(chan, channel);
00567    check_mute();
00568 }
00569 
00570 static void offhook_chan(char *channel)
00571 {
00572    struct channel *chan;
00573    if (debug)
00574       printf("Offhook '%s'\n", channel);
00575    chan = find_channel(channel);
00576    if (chan)
00577       append_sub(chan, channel);
00578    check_mute();
00579 }
00580 
00581 static int wait_event(void)
00582 {
00583    char *resp;
00584    char event[120]="";
00585    char channel[120]="";
00586    char oldname[120]="";
00587    char newname[120]="";
00588 
00589    resp = get_line();
00590    if (!resp) {
00591       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (6)\n");
00592       return -1;
00593    }
00594    if (!strncasecmp(resp, "Event: ", strlen("Event: "))) {
00595       strncpy(event, resp + strlen("Event: "), sizeof(event) - 1);
00596       /* Consume the rest of the non-event */
00597       while((resp = get_line()) && strlen(resp)) {
00598          if (!strncasecmp(resp, "Channel: ", strlen("Channel: ")))
00599             strncpy(channel, resp + strlen("Channel: "), sizeof(channel) - 1);
00600          if (!strncasecmp(resp, "Newname: ", strlen("Newname: ")))
00601             strncpy(newname, resp + strlen("Newname: "), sizeof(newname) - 1);
00602          if (!strncasecmp(resp, "Oldname: ", strlen("Oldname: ")))
00603             strncpy(oldname, resp + strlen("Oldname: "), sizeof(oldname) - 1);
00604       }
00605       if (strlen(channel)) {
00606          if (!strcasecmp(event, "Hangup")) 
00607             hangup_chan(channel);
00608          else
00609             offhook_chan(channel);
00610       }
00611       if (strlen(newname) && strlen(oldname)) {
00612          if (!strcasecmp(event, "Rename")) {
00613             hangup_chan(oldname);
00614             offhook_chan(newname);
00615          }
00616       }
00617    } else {
00618       /* Consume the rest of the non-event */
00619       while((resp = get_line()) && strlen(resp));
00620    }
00621    if (!resp) {
00622       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (7)\n");
00623       return -1;
00624    }
00625    return 0;
00626 }
00627 
00628 static void usage(void)
00629 {
00630    printf("Usage: muted [-f] [-d]\n"
00631           "        -f : Do not fork\n"
00632           "        -d : Debug (implies -f)\n");
00633 }
00634 
00635 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00636 {
00637    int x;
00638    while((x = getopt(argc, argv, "fhd")) > 0) {
00639       switch(x) {
00640       case 'd':
00641          debug = 1;
00642          needfork = 0;
00643          break;
00644       case 'f':
00645          needfork = 0;
00646          break;
00647       case 'h':
00648          /* Fall through */
00649       default:
00650          usage();
00651          exit(1);
00652       }
00653    }
00654    if (load_config())
00655       exit(1);
00656 #ifndef __Darwin__
00657    if (open_mixer())
00658       exit(1);
00659 #endif
00660    if (connect_asterisk()) {
00661 #ifndef __Darwin__
00662       close(mixfd);
00663 #endif
00664       exit(1);
00665    }
00666    if (login_asterisk()) {
00667 #ifndef __Darwin__      
00668       close(mixfd);
00669 #endif
00670       fclose(astf);
00671       exit(1);
00672    }
00673    if (needfork)
00674       daemon(0,0);
00675    for(;;) {
00676       if (wait_event()) {
00677          fclose(astf);
00678          while(connect_asterisk()) {
00679             sleep(5);
00680          }
00681          if (login_asterisk()) {
00682             fclose(astf);
00683             exit(1);
00684          }
00685       }
00686    }
00687    exit(0);
00688 }
